title: Communication Geth <-> Ethminer / RPC broken - long pause and 0MH
body:
Several users and me (see skype chat miner community support) experience a bug in the currrent set of the latest devs of geth and ethminer.

Log of the ethminer looks like this:
https://gist.github.com/Phistr90/eeed14834567c2bac8e4

Basically 0MH, and the pause intervall increases step by step up to ~45000ms and then starts again with a pause of 1000ms.
Randomly the ethminer starts mining sometimes but for a very short time (just briefly during one work load).

I am not sure if the reason for this behavior is geth or ethminer's fault.
Looks like it's an rpc problem.

To my setup:
OS: Ubuntu
Rig 1: RPC is onlocalhost
Rig 2: RPC is located in LAN

Problem occurs on Rig1 and Rig2. Both setup uses the farm option.
All clients and ethminer are on the latest dev.

confirm this bug
https://gist.github.com/981be763062cdb6dd5ec

uname -a
Linux ubuntu-server-amd64 3.13.0-55-generic #94-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jun 18 00:27:10 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Issue is due to ethminer. They reverted a commit by commenting the parts out. but compiling was not possible for me since they disabled the treat warning as error and there was a unsued function.
Should be fixed soon.

geth team 1: cpp team: 0 :laughing:
